Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Row over a retweet, AAP accuses Delhi election officer of brazen BJP biasSanjay Singh accused the District Election Officer of secretly retweeting BJP's posts on X. The DEO clarified that the post was mistakenly retweeted.

Panel advises action against 'individual' months after Pannun murder plot chargeThe government's enquiry panel recommended action against an "individual" with criminal links, without directly referring to the alleged failed assassination plot of Khalistani terrorist Pannun.

Add Galwan, Siachen to holiday plan. India is opening battle tourism bunkerNow, tourists can add historical battleground sites of the Indian armed forces to their list of travel destinations. The Indian Army, in association with the Ministry of Tourism, is launching Bharat Ranbhoomi Darshan, and would open up 77 battleground spots, including those in Siachen, Kargil and Galwan.

Canada revises family open work permits, may benefit thousands of IndiansCanada relaxes open work permit rules for spouses of international students and foreign workers starting January 21, 2025. Spouses of eligible students and workers in high-demand job sectors will be able to apply for an open work permit (OWP). Indian students, who make up a large portion of Canada's international student population, will benefit.

When Elisha Otis's daring elevator stunt shocked audiences to sell safetyIn 1854, Elisha Otis pulled off one of history's greatest marketing moves, performing a theatrical, public demonstration to prove his elevator safety device worked. This innovation would go on to reshape cities and enable skyscrapers, forever changing modern living.

How RSS has impacted vastu of new Congress headquartersAfter five decades at 24, Akbar Road, the Congress has moved to a new headquarters, Indira Bhawan, a kilometre from the BJP head office at Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg. Wary of having an office on a road named after the long-dead RSS ideologue, the Congress is using its back door as the main entrance. It has preferred Kotla to Upadhyay.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Courtto recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination afterdiscrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
